summary: Rift Valley fever virus (RVFV) is a mosquito-borne zoonotic pathogen. it is distributed in sub-saharan africa and has caused large outbreaks in endemic areas. a small percentage of patients have an acute febrile myalgic syndrome. segment encodes N and NSs genes and uses an ambi-sense strategy to express the N and NSs proteins in infected cells. NSs mRNA encoding NSs protein is transcribed from the viral-sense (negative-sense) S segment. monocistronic M mRNA and L mRNA are transcribed from the viral-sense M and L segments, respectively. cytoplasmic NSs suppresses the transcription of host mRNAs by interacting with the p44 subunit of TFIIH, an essential transcriptional factor for cellular RNA polymerase II. NSs protein in the nucleus of infected cells most likely exerts these host transcriptional-suppressive activities, including that of IFN- promoter activation early in infection.
